geo:siteIdentification.geo:notes: Predominant rocks at the station O'Higgins are quartz-bearing black, grey and reddish brown low-metamorphic clay slates and phylitte slates of the Trinity Peninsula Formation. They are very brittle, fine-laminated in the mm- and cm-range and incline with about 60 to 80 degrees to NW. Because of these characteristics and the high clay mineral content and the expansive force resulting from this the slates are highly susceptible to weathering and mostly covered by detrital layers. Only tectonicly less stressed parts and parts resistant to weathering stick out from these detrital masses. These have a linear geometry and show strong cleavings. The instrusions of 0.5m to 1.5m thick vein rocks, which pass through the slates, are significantly younger. The pillar with the antenna is bolted into one of these veins, which are very resistant to weathering. A ROGUE SNR-8000 / ACT SNR-8000 ACT operated from 1995-02-14 until 2002-02-20 at the German Antarctic Receiving Station GARS in Higgins / Antarctica with the four character ID OHIG, on pillar K5, DOMES Number 66008M001. Because of the expansion and of construction works in the Chilenean Antarctic Base the antenna for the GPS Permanent Tracking Station OHIG was moved to another pillar K6, DOMES Number 66008M005, 2002-02-14, new four charcater ID OHI2. For collocation we observed from 2002-02-14 until 2002-02-20 with two AOA SNR-8000 ACT at OHIG and OHI2, and also with the Ashtech Z-18 OHIZ. 2002-02-14 OHI2 installed. 2002-02-16 DOME removed in OHIG. 2002-02-19 DOME installed in OHI2. 2002-02-20 OHIG removed. In addition and parallel also an ASHTECH Z18 GPS+GLONASS System, was operating in O'Higgins. From 2001-02-09 until 2003-01-27 with four character ID OHIZ, DOMES Number 66008M004. Because of the expansion and of construction works in the Chilenean Antarctic Base the antenna for the GPS+GLONASS Permanent Tracking Station OHIZ was moved to another pillar K3, DOMES Number 66008M006, 2003-02-06, new four charcater ID OHI3. A re-examination and survey in O'Higgins February 2003 reported necessary corrections. The correct antenna-height = Marker Up Ecc for OHIG from 1995-02-14 until 2002-02-20 was 0.0030 m, instead of 0.0010 m. The correct antenna-height = Marker Up Ecc for OHI2 since 2002-02-14 was -0.0080 m, instead of 0.0008 m. In addition a LEICA GR25 GPS+GLO+GAL+SBAS system is operating on pillar K3, DOMES Number 66008M006, four character ID OHI3.

geo:gnssAntenna.geo:notes: Antenna height was incorrectly reported as 0.0008 m, instead of correct -0.0080 m.
Modfied Radome as used for Inmarsat A equipments. Used also for former OHIG. Antenna height was incorrectly reported as 0.0008 m, instead of correct -0.0080 m until 2003-02-23.
Modfied Radome as used for Inmarsat A equipments. Used also for former OHIG. Correctly antenna-height -0.0080 m in the RINEX-Headers since 2003-02-23.

geo:surveyedLocalTies.geo:notes: Differential Components from the Marker Pillar K6 OHI2 to the Point of Axis-Intersection in the VLBI Radiotelescope. dx, dy, dz = Marker Pillar K6 OHI2 minus Axis-Intersection VLBI.

GPS Permanent Tracking Station OHIG at Pillar K5 from 1995-02-14 until 2002-02-20. Differential Components from the Marker Pillar K6 OHI2 to the Marker Pillar K5 OHIG. dx, dy, dz = Marker Pillar K6 OHI2 minus Marker Pillar K5 OHIG.

GPS+GLONASS Permanent Tracking Station OHIZ from 2001-02-09 until 2003-01-27. Differential Components from the Marker Pillar K6 OHI2 to the ARP of the OHIZ antenna, not to the OHIZ Marker. The ARP of the OHIZ antenna was 0.1215 m above the OHIZ Marker. dx, dy, dz = Marker Pillar K6 OHI2 minus ARP OHIZ antenna.

GPS+GLONASS Permanent Tracking Station OHI3 at pillar K3 since 2003-02-06. Differentiel Components from the Marker Pillar K6 OHI2 to the Marker Pillar K3 OHI3. dx, dy, dz = Marker Pillar K6 OHI2 minus Marker Pillar K3 OHI3.
